basic_data.cell_line_alt_name: HPIi005-A; HPIi005 R: RYR1-5-9214-iPSC clone R5

generator.group: Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research

contact.group: Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research

publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a 33-year-old central core disease patient with a heterozygous dominant c.14145_14156delCTACTGGGACA (p.Asn4715_Asp4718del) deletion in the RYR1 gene

donor.disease_description: Central core disease (CCD) is a congenital disorder that results in hypotonia, delayed motor development, and areas of reduced oxidative activity in the muscle fiber.

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous dominant c.14145_14156delCTACTGGGACA (p.Asn4715_Asp4718del) deletion in the RYR1 gene

genomic_characterisation.summary: No statistically significant chromosomal abnormalities were detected. Both clones possessed a normal female karyotype (46, XX).

ethics.institutional_HREC: Comité de Protection des Personnes (Est IV)
University of Western Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
